channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Latest remains returned to Israel from Gaza are not bodies of hostages, an Israeli official says
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people handed over by Hamas to the Red Cross this week do not belong to any of the hostages, an Israeli military official said Saturday, the latest development that could undermine the U.S.-brokered agreement for a ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization
item.description: Egypt on Saturday is inaugurating the Grand Egyptian Museum, aiming to boost tourism and revitalize the economy.
item.dc:creator: By Samy Magdy, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Top diplomats from Germany, Jordan and the UK call for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan war
item.description: Foreign ministers from Germany, Jordan and the United Kingdom have called for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan.
item.dc:creator: Jon Gambrell, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Tanzania President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: DODOMA, Tanzania (AP) — Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced early Saturday, in a rare landslide victory in the region.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Red Cross said it transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel late Friday but they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages, an Israeli military official said.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Protesters call for governor’s resignation after Rio’s deadliest police raid
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Hundreds of protesters on Friday marched through one of the favelas targeted in Rio de Janeiro's most lethal police raid that left more than 100 dead, calling for Rio state Gov. Cláudio Castro to resign amid continued outrage over the deadly operation.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Groups of gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan attacked in several waves, abducting doctors and nurses, then gunning down staff, patients and people sheltering there, the World Health Organization said Friday.
item.dc:creator: SARAH EL DEEB and JAMEY KEATEN, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Trump designates Nigeria as 'country of particular concern' over widespread Christian persecution, killings
item.description: Christian persecution in Nigeria has ramped up dramatically as Islamist militants burn villages and kill thousands of believers in targeted attacks across the country.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Royal prerogative: King Charles III banishes Andrew to buttress the House of Windsor's foundations
item.description: No one is bigger than the monarchy. Not even the king’s brother. In the end, that reality spelled the end of Andrew’s life as a prince of the realm.
item.dc:creator: DANICA KIRKA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: UN human rights chief calls on Pentagon to halt strikes on suspected drug boats
item.description: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called for the Pentagon to halt boat strikes against vessels suspected to be carrying drugs in order to prevent “extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Aid teams flock to Jamaica to help with Hurricane Melissa recovery
item.description: David Archer, deputy governor of the British Virgin Islands, told NewsNation he's seen many organizations eager to help.
item.dc:creator: Anna Kutz, NewsNation

item.title: Latvian Parliament votes to withdraw from domestic violence treaty
item.description: WARSAW, Poland (AP) — The Latvian Parliament voted Thursday to withdraw from the Istanbul Convention, a treaty aimed at supporting women who are victims of violence, after a 13-hour session of intense debate.
item.dc:creator: CLAUDIA CIOBANU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ex-Mossad chief behind Iran nuclear warehouse raid says Iran’s atomic sites ‘obliterated,’ credits Trump
item.description: Former Mossad director reveals Iran's nuclear sites were "obliterated" in U.S. strikes, warns Tehran that Israel "can come again" if uranium enrichment resumes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Serbia youth lead thousands on march for weekend rally marking deadly canopy collapse last year
item.description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — Thousands of mainly young people in Serbia embarked on a two-day march from Belgrade on Thursday, aiming to join a major rally in the country's north this weekend that will mark the anniversary of a deadly train station disaster.
item.dc:creator: JOVANA GEC, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump seeks energy deal with China amid broader trade talks
item.description: President Trump is eyeing an energy deal with China, he said in a social media post Thursday. He said in a post on Truth Social that Beijing has agreed to begin purchasing U.S. energy and that a “very large scale transaction” related to oil and gas from Alaska "may take place.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Frazin, The Hill

item.title: 5 more arrests made in Louvre jewel heist
item.description: It took thieves less than eight minutes to steal the jewels valued at $102 million. The treasures remain missing.
item.dc:creator: ANGELA CHARLTON and THOMAS ADAMSON, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — Hurricane Melissa left at least dozens dead and caused widespread destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica, where roofless homes, toppled utility poles and water-logged furniture dominated the landscape Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ, JOHN MYERS JR. and EVENS SANON, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to start testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that he has instructed the Defense Department to immediately begin testing U.S. nuclear weapons on an equal basis to China and Russia. “The United States has more Nuclear Weapons than any other country,” Trump wrote.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, NewsNation

item.title: Hegseth says military conducted another strike on boat carrying alleged narco-terrorists
item.description: The U.S. military targeted another alleged narco-trafficking boat, sparking congressional concerns over due process and legal authority for the deadly strikes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Israel's military says ceasefire is back on as death toll from Gaza strikes reaches 104
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel’s military said Wednesday that the ceasefire was back on in Gaza after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight across the Palestinian territory that killed 104 people, including 66 women and children, according to local health officials.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JOSH BOAK, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Corpses line Rio street, pushing death toll from police raids to 132
item.description: The police operation came days before Rio hosts global events related to the United Nations climate summit known as COP30
item.dc:creator: Janaina Quinet and Rodrigo Viga Gaier / Reuters, NewsNation

item.title: Putin hails successful test of nuclear-powered underwater torpedo
item.description: Putin announced successful Poseidon nuclear drone testing as President Donald Trump urged Russia to end the Ukraine war instead of testing missiles on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: New Jersey man's Titanic belongings recovered expected to auction for more than $100K
item.description: Frederick Sutton's Titanic personal effects, including gold watch and first-class passenger list, remain in family hands for over a century before auction.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Amnesty says deadly US strike on Yemen prison may be a war crime
item.description: An American airstrike in April on a prison run by Yemen's Houthi rebels killed more than 60 detained African migrants.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: US sending strike boats to Venezuela for 'shock and awe' effect: Senator
item.description: "I think maybe the president is sending a message that, look, we're serious about it," Sen. Mike Rounds told "On Balance.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation

item.title: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa brings flooding and catastrophic winds to Jamaica
item.description: KINGSTON, Jamaica (AP) — Heavy floodwaters swept across southwestern Jamaica, winds tore roofs off buildings and boulders tumbled onto roads Tuesday as Hurricane Melissa pummeled the Caribbean island as a catastrophic Category 5 storm, one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes on record.
item.dc:creator: DÁNICA COTO and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Here's how tariffs could impact holiday shopping season: Analysis
item.description: If current tariffs had been in place last year, consumers would have faced a $28.6 billion burden, a new analysis finds.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dorn, NewsNation

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Hamas exchange fire and blame
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli army launched a barrage of attacks in Gaza on Tuesday as tensions with Hamas grew two weeks into a fragile ceasefire, and the militant group responded by saying it would delay handing over the body of a hostage.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Photos as Hurricane Melissa makes landfall as Category 5 storm
item.description: "Don't bet against Melissa because you will lose," warned Jamaican Government Minister Desmond McKenzie.
item.dc:creator: Sean Noone, NewsNation

item.title: Video: Hurricane Hunters inside Melissa's eye
item.description: The Hunters wrote on social media Tuesday that they were forced to turn back from another mission into the eye of Melissa due to "heavy turbulence.
item.dc:creator: Zach Kaplan, NewsNation

item.title: Ukraine's long-range strikes cut Russia's oil refining capacity by 20%, Zelenskyy says
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine’s long-range strikes on refineries inside Russia have reduced Moscow’s oil refining capacity by 20%, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, citing intelligence from Western governments.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Half of uncontacted Indigenous groups could be gone in decade: Report
item.description: "These are what I would call silent genocides — there are no TV crews, no journalists," said Survival International's Fiona Watson.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation
